sub_topic: The Hausdorff dimension of the Cantor dust.
message_1: What is the Hausdorff dimension of the Cantor dust fractal constructed from removing the middle third from an interval of length 1, then repeating the process recursively on the remaining line segments until an infinite number of line segments are obtained?
message_2:
The Cantor dust fractal you described is also known as the Cantor set. The Hausdorff dimension of the Cantor set can be calculated using the formula:

Hausdorff dimension = log(N) / log(1/s)

where N is the number of self-similar pieces and s is the scaling factor.

In the case of the Cantor set, at each step, the interval is divided into 3 equal parts and the middle third is removed, leaving 2 remaining parts. So, N = 2 and the scaling factor s = 3.

Hausdorff dimension = log(2) / log(3) â‰ˆ 0.6309

So, the Hausdorff dimension of the Cantor set is approximately 0.6309.
